content: The Act titled "Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014" includes a Mortgage Foreclosure Moratorium. The "Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014" includes a Mortgage Foreclosure Moratorium where the Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency prohibits foreclosure actions on eligible mortgages and defers mortgage payments during the moratorium period. The "Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014" includes a Mortgage Foreclosure Moratorium where the Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency prohibits foreclosure actions on eligible mortgages. Interest on outstanding principal continues to accrue at the mortgage rate, and upon the moratorium expiration, mortgage payments resume with accrued interest being amortized over the remaining term of the mortgage. An eligible mortgage is one owned, held, securitized, or guaranteed by the agency. The Mortgage Foreclosure Moratorium under the "Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014" applies to mortgages owned by Federal National Mortgage Association or Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation, on 1- to 4-family residences, with current payments and mortgagors who received unemployment compensation by January 1, 2014. The Mortgage Foreclosure Moratorium applies to individuals who have exhausted unemployment compensation rights under state law from January 1, 2014, to the date of enactment of the Act, and have remained continuously unemployed. Additionally, it applies to those who exhaust rights under state law from the date of enactment to July 1, 2014, and have a specific debt to income ratio at the beginning of the foreclosure moratorium period. The Director shall establish requirements for a foreclosure moratorium period of 6 months for eligible mortgages, starting from the enactment of the Act or when the mortgagor exhausts unemployment compensation rights. The term "Director" refers to the Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency. The Federal Housing Finance Agency defines terms related to eligible mortgages, foreclosure moratorium periods, and mortgagees. Regular, extended, and additional compensation are also defined in the context of the Act. The curr_chunk discusses the meanings of terms as defined in section 205 of the Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970.
